definition[0]: to move unsteadily from side to side, or make something do this
example[0]: The pile of bricks wobbled and fell.
example[1]: Tom stopped, wobbling from the weight of his load.
definition[1]: to go in a particular direction while moving unsteadily from side to side
example[2]: Cindy wobbled along the street on her bike.
definition[2]: to be unsure whether to do something
example[3]: The president appeared to wobble over sending the troops in.
